subject: Re: [junit] JUnit 3 - compatibility - getName() method
msgSnippet: Anthony, In your Base Test setUp() , do something like logger.info( Running Test:  + this.getClass() + . + this.getName() + n ); use log4j or common
messageBody:
Anthony,

In your Base Test setUp() , do something like

logger.info("Running Test: " + this.getClass() + "." + this.getName() + "\n");



use log4j or common loggging to setup the logger



Hope this helps



-Kamal.

----- Original Message -----
From: MULLER Anthony
To: junit@yahoogroups.com
Sent: Wednesday, March 26, 2008 5:18 AM
Subject: [junit] JUnit 3 - compatibility - getName() method


Hello!

What is the equivalent method to TestCase.getName() previously in Junit3 ?

This method returned the method name during the test execution.

Thanks!

Regards,
Anthony
